HelpXML.Title: TBc
HelpXML.Purpose: TBc computes breakdown point and efficiency associated with constant c for Tukey's biweight

Item.Name: c
Item.LongDesc: Scalar greater than 0 which controls the robustness/efficiency of the estimator

Item.Name: v
Item.LongDesc: Number of variables of the dataset (for regression v=1)

Item.Name: shapeeff
Item.LongDesc: If shapeeff=1, the efficiency is referred to the shape else (default) is referred to the location estimator

Item.Name: bdp
Item.LongDesc: Breakdown point associated to the supplied value of c

Item.Name: eff
Item.LongDesc: Efficiency associated to the supplied value of c Remark: if c is a vector bdp and eff will also be vectors with the same size of c. For example bdp(3) and eff(3) are associated to c(3) ....

Item.Name: approxsheff
Item.LongDesc: Approximate value of efficiency in case input option shapeeff=1 and v>1. This output is left for comparability with the value which comes out from R library robustbase.

References.Item: Frank R. Hampel, Peter J. Rousseeuw and Elvezio Ronchetti (1981), The Change-of-Variance Curve and Optimal Redescending M-Estimators, Journal of the American Statistical Association , Vol. 76, No. 375, pp. 643-648 (HRR)

Item.Title: Tbc with just one output argument.
Tbc with 2 output arguments.
Item.MATLABcode: [bdp,eff]=TBc(2,1) disp('Break down point and efficienty') disp(bdp) disp(eff)

Item.Title: Find also approximate value of scale efficienty (for R comparability).
Breakdown point and efficiency.
Item.Desc: Analysis of breakdown point and asymptotic efficiency at the normal distribution as a function of c in regression.
Item.MATLABcode: c=1:0.01:6; [bdp,eff]=TBc(c,1); subplot(2,1,1) plot(c,bdp) xlabel('c','Interpreter','Latex','FontSize',16) ylabel('Breakdown point','Interpreter','none') subplot(2,1,2) plot(c,eff) xlabel('c','Interpreter','Latex','FontSize',16) ylabel('Asymptotic efficiency','Interpreter','none')
